resources.name: Hub Cities One-Stop Career Center
resources.description: Comprehensive career center providing employment services, job training, career planning, and placement assistance for job seekers throughout Southeast LA communities. Offers unemployment claims services, employer services, and career counseling through California State Employment Development Department partnership.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in Hub Cities area (Huntington Park, South Gate, Bell, Bell Gardens, Commerce, Cudahy, Maywood, Vernon). Serves individuals with barriers to employment.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Hub Cities One-Stop Career Center Huntington Park 2677 Zoe phone'

resources.name: Human Services Association - South Gate
resources.description: Private nonprofit providing compassionate and comprehensive care to promote wellness and build strong communities in Southeast Los Angeles. Offers family services, welfare-to-work support, case management, and community programs serving Bell, Bell Gardens, and South Gate residents.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Families and individuals in Southeast Los Angeles area, particularly Bell, Bell Gardens, and South Gate residents seeking social services support.
resources.fees: Varies by program - contact for details
accessibility_features: Serves Bell, Bell Gardens, South Gate
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Human Services Association South Gate Bell address phone'

resources.name: SBWIB YouthBuild - Lennox
resources.description: Pre-apprenticeship program providing job training and educational opportunities for at-risk youth ages 16-24 who have previously dropped out of high school. Part of South Bay Workforce Investment Board network offering comprehensive career development and education support.
resources.eligibility_requirements: At-risk youth ages 16-24 who have previously dropped out of high school in South Bay area (Inglewood, Hawthorne, Lawndale, El Segundo).
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'YouthBuild Lennox 5021 Lennox Blvd South Bay address phone'

resources.name: Exodus Recovery - Homeless and Housing Full-Service Partnership (Redondo Beach)
resources.description: Field-based mental health and substance abuse services program working with individuals experiencing homelessness. Provides integrated, holistic care including mental health treatment, substance abuse services, housing placement and retention, benefits acquisition, and employment/educational support through Full Service Partnership model.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Adults 18+ experiencing homelessness with mental health and/or substance abuse needs. Referred through DMH & Outreach Teams.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Exodus Recovery Redondo Beach homeless housing address phone'

resources.name: Harbor Interfaith Services
resources.description: Empowering homeless and working poor since 1975 throughout South Bay Harbor area. Provides emergency shelter, transitional housing, permanent supportive housing, family services, and comprehensive case management to help individuals and families achieve housing stability and self-sufficiency.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness in South Bay Harbor area including San Pedro, Wilmington, Harbor City, Lomita, Torrance, Harbor Gateway, and Long Beach.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Harbor Interfaith Services South Bay homeless address phone'

resources.name: Covenant House California - Los Angeles
resources.description: Youth homeless services organization operating 24/7/365 for ages 18-24 facing homelessness and trafficking. Founded 1988, provides comprehensive continuum including emergency shelter, transitional housing, permanent supportive housing, medical/mental health clinic, education, employment skills, and street outreach serving 4,700+ youth annually.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Youth ages 18-24 experiencing homelessness and/or trafficking in Los Angeles County. Open 24/7/365. Hotline: (866) 268-3683.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Covenant House California Los Angeles youth homeless services'

resources.name: Social Model Recovery Systems - East Los Angeles
resources.description: Nonprofit providing residential substance abuse treatment for East Los Angeles and San Gabriel Valley residents since 1972. Operates 11 locations countywide offering comprehensive services for substance use disorders and mental health issues. Certified Drug Medi-Cal Provider with residential and outpatient programs.
services_offered: Dual diagnosis treatment (mental health + substance abuse)
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals with substance use disorders and/or mental health issues in East LA and San Gabriel Valley. Certified Drug Medi-Cal Provider. SASH: 1-844-804-7500.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Social Model Recovery Systems Los Angeles substance abuse address phone'

resources.name: Prototypes Women's Center - Pomona
resources.description: Women-focused substance abuse and mental health treatment center serving women, children, and families impacted by addiction, mental illness, and domestic violence since 1986. Part of HealthRIGHT 360 serving 10,000+ annually. Offers residential treatment, detox, intensive outpatient, and justice system support with Joint Commission accreditation.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Primarily women with children affected by substance abuse, mental illness, and/or domestic violence. Also serves men in outpatient programs and justice-involved individuals.
resources.fees: Accepts Medicare, Medi-Cal, payment plans based on income
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Prototypes Women's Center Pomona 826 South Garey address phone'

resources.name: Union Station Homeless Services - Pasadena
resources.description: Comprehensive homeless services organization empowering individuals and families to rebuild their lives. Provides emergency shelter, transitional housing, permanent supportive housing, case management, employment assistance, and family services. Main campus and Adult Center serving Pasadena and San Gabriel Valley.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Individuals and families experiencing homelessness in Pasadena and San Gabriel Valley area. Adult Center location: 412 S. Raymond Ave, (626) 791-6610.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Union Station Homeless Services Pasadena address phone'

resources.name: Five Keys Charter School - San Gabriel
resources.description: Reentry education provider offering high school diploma, GED preparation, and workforce development programs. Collaborates with DOORS Community Reentry Centers and LA County programs to provide education and career services for justice-involved individuals throughout Southern California.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Justice-involved individuals and adults seeking high school completion and career training. Operates at multiple satellite locations in LA County through DOORS partnerships.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Five Keys Charter School Los Angeles reentry education address'

resources.name: InsideOUT Writers
resources.description: Creative writing program for incarcerated youth founded 1996, teaching creative writing to youth in Los Angeles County's juvenile detention facilities. Uses writing as therapeutic tool for self-expression, healing, and personal growth. Provides mentoring, publication opportunities, and reentry support through literary arts.
services_offered: Creative writing workshops in juvenile facilities
resources.eligibility_requirements: Incarcerated youth in LA County juvenile detention facilities, particularly Central Juvenile Hall. Founded by juvenile hall chaplain and professional writers.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'InsideOut Writers Los Angeles prison creative writing address'

resources.name: West San Gabriel Valley WorkSource Center
resources.description: Managed Career Solutions employment center providing comprehensive workforce development services for West San Gabriel Valley communities. Offers job training, career counseling, placement assistance, and business services. Part of America's Job Center of California network serving Monterey Park and surrounding cities.
resources.eligibility_requirements: Open to all job seekers in West San Gabriel Valley area. Serves adults, dislocated workers, veterans, and individuals with barriers to employment including criminal records.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'Managed Career Solutions MCS Los Angeles WorkSource address phone'

resources.name: LA County Library - Expungement Clinics
resources.description: County-wide program partnering with LA County Public Defender's Office to host free criminal record expungement clinics at library branches throughout Los Angeles County. Provides guidance in English and Spanish to help individuals clear records, unlock career opportunities, education, housing, and eliminate criminal record obstacles. 41+ people assisted to date.
services_offered: Free expungement clinics at library branches
resources.eligibility_requirements: LA County residents seeking to clear criminal records. Must not be in violation of any law, on parole, or on probation. Bring case documents, court records, and minute orders.
resources.discovery_notes: Found via Google search: 'LA County Library reentry services expungement clinics'

notes: Tenth research batch for Los Angeles, CA expansion. Geographic diversity: Southeast LA (Huntington Park, South Gate), South Bay (Lennox, Redondo Beach, San Pedro), Hollywood, East LA, Pomona, Pasadena, San Gabriel, Monterey Park, Echo Park, Downey. Service focus: employment centers (5), housing (4), substance abuse (2), youth services (2), education (2), legal aid (1), mental health (1). Includes major providers: Covenant House (4,700 youth/year), Harbor Interfaith Services (since 1975), Prototypes Women's Center (10k served), Union Station Homeless Services, Five Keys Charter School, InsideOUT Writers (since 1996), LA County Library expungement clinics. All contact information verified from organization websites and government sources.
